revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Maulik Pancholy | image = Maulik pancholy cropped.jpg | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1974|1|18}} | birth_place = [[Dayton, Ohio]], U.S. | occupation = Actor | years_active = 1998–present | spouse = Ryan Corvaia (m. 2014) | education = [[Northwestern University]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])}}
[[Yale University]] {{small|([[Master of Fine Arts|MFA]])}} }} '''Maulik Navin Pancholy ''' ({{IPAc-en|m|oʊ|l|iː|k|_|n|ɑː|v|ɪ|n|_|p|æ|n|ˈ|tʃ|oʊ|l|i}}, born January 18, 1974) is an [[United States|American]] actor who is best known for his roles as Jonathan on ''[[30 Rock]]'', [[Baljeet Tjinder]] in ''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'', Neal in the first season of ''[[Whitney (TV series)|Whitney]]'', and characters named Sanjay Patel in ''[[Weeds (TV series)|Weeds]]'' and ''[[Sanjay and Craig]]''. ==Early life== Pancholy was born in [[Dayton, Ohio]]. He moved around while growing up, living in Ohio, Indiana, and Texas before his family settled in [[Tampa, Florida]], where he attended junior high and high school.{{cite news|title=Angry Reader of the Week: Maulik Pancholy|url=http://blog.angryasianman.com/2014/10/angry-reader-of-week-maulik-pancholy.html|accessdate=April 24, 2018|work=Angry Asian Man|date=October 10, 2014}} His family comes from [[Gujarat]], and his grandparents live in [[Ahmedabad]].{{cite news|last1=Dayal|first1=Priyanka|title=Rock Star: A Conversation with Maulik Pancholy|url=http://www.abcdlady.com/2009-05/art1.php|accessdate=29 April 2015|work=ABCD Lady}} He is a 1991 graduate of the [[Berkeley Preparatory School]] in Tampa, and went on to major in Theatre at [[Northwestern University]], where he received his [[bachelor's degree]] in 1995.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0997689/bio |title=Maulik Pancholy - Biography |work=The Internet Movie Database | accessdate=15 March 2012 }} He then attended the [[Yale School of Drama]], where he received his [[Master of Fine Arts]] in 2003.{{cite news | author=Gregory Kirschling | date=11 May 2007 | title=Maulik Pancholy: You Might Know Me From...The 33-year-old | work=Entertainment Weekly | url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20037736,00.html | accessdate=15 March 2012 }} ==Career== Pancholy's television work includes guest roles on ''[[Tracey Takes On...]]'', ''[[The Sopranos]]'', ''[[Law & Order: Criminal Intent]]'', and ''[[The Comeback (TV series)|The Comeback]]''. His stage credits in New York City include the Culture Project's production of ''Guantanamo: Honor Bound to Defend Freedom'' in 2004, a workshop of the play ''Morbidity & Mortality'' at the historic [[Cherry Lane Theatre]] in 2005, and the lead role in ''India Awaiting'' at the Samuel Beckett Theatre. In January 2015, he joined the cast of [[Terrence McNally]]'s ''[[It's Only a Play]]'', replacing [[Rupert Grint]] when the production's Broadway run was extended.Gordon, David.[http://www.theatermania.com/new-york-city-theater/news/martin-short-katie-finneran-maulik-pancholy-photos_71297.html "It's Only a Play's New Stars Martin Short, Katie Finneran, and Maulik Pancholy Meet the Press"] theatermania.com, January 13, 2015 Washington DC stage credits include Katherina in an all male version of the Shakespear's Theatre Company's "The Taming of The Shrew" in 2016. As 'Kevin' in the World premier engagement of Ken Urban's "The Remains" at the Studio Theatre in 2018. On February 13, 2017 StarTrek.com stated that Pancholy will play Nambue, Chief Medical Officer of the USS ''Shenzhou'' in the upcoming TV series ''[[Star Trek: Discovery]]''. The series' pilot episode is set to air in September 2017, and season one is to air on CBS streaming service in America and [[Netflix]] abroad.Schwindt, Oriana (February 13, 2017). "'Star Trek: Discovery' Adds Three More Starfleet Members". Variety. Archived from the original on February 14, 2017. Retrieved February 14, 2017 ==Personal life== Pancholy [[Coming out|came out]] as [[gay]] in a November 2013 interview with ''[[Out (magazine)|Out]]'' magazine in which he discussed his partner of nine years, chef/caterer Ryan Corvaia.{{cite news | date=11 November 2013 | title=Out100: Maulik Pancholy | work=Out Magazine | url=http://www.out.com/out-exclusives/out100-2013/2013/11/11/out100-maulik-pancholy | accessdate=11 November 2013}} They got engaged at the [[Taj Mahal]] in January 2014 and were married in September that year.{{cite news|last1=Kennedy|first1=Ed|title=Maulik Pancholy Woke Up a Married Man|url=http://www.thebacklot.com/maulik-pancholy-woke-up-a-married-man/09/2014/|accessdate=29 April 2015|work=The Backlot|date=September 28, 2014}} Pancholy speaks [[Gujarati language|Gujarati]] and [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. He is also proficient in [[Hindi]], which he speaks in the ''30 Rock'' episode "[[Khonani]]".{{cite web|last1=Pancholy|first1=Maulik|title=That Khonani brings it out of me|url=https://twitter.com/maulikpancholy/status/99328868263018496|date=4 August 2011|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=29 April 2015}} ===Political activism=== On April 25, 2014, Pancholy was named to [[President of the United States|President]] [[Barack Obama]]'s Advisory Commission on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders as part of the [[White House Initiative on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders]].{{cite web |url=https://www.advocate.com/politics/2014/04/27/out-actor-maulik-pancholy-named-white-house-commission |title=Out Actor Maulik Pancholy Named to White House Commission |last=Garcia |first=Michelle |date=27 April 2014 |publisher=''[[The Advocate]]'' |accessdate=22 June 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.gaystarnews.com/article/out-actor-maulik-pancholy-appointed-white-house-advisory-commission280414/ |title=Out actor Maulik Pancholy appointed to White House advisory commission |last=Withers |first=James |date=27 April 2014 |publisher=[[Gay Star News]] |accessdate=22 June 2017}}{{cite press release |author= |title=President Obama Announces his Intent to Appoint Fourteen Individuals to the President’s Advisory Commission on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders |url=https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2014/04/24/president-obama-announces-his-intent-appoint-fourteen-individuals-presid |publisher=The White House |date=24 April 2014 |access-date=22 June 2017}} On February 25, 2017, Pancholy and nine other members of the commission resigned from their positions, citing administrative actions by President [[Donald Trump]] that they claimed went "against the commission's principles".{{cite web |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/asian-america/10-resign-president-s-advisory-commission-asian-americans-pacific-islanders-n721386 |title=10 Resign from President’s Advisory Commission on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders |last=Lee |first=Traci G. |date=16 February 2017 |publisher=[[NBC News]] |accessdate=22 June 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.avclub.com/article/30-rocks-maulik-pancholy-just-quit-presidential-co-250606 |title=''30 Rock''’s Maulik Pancholy just quit a presidential commission because of Donald Trump |last=Hughes |first=William |date=18 February 2017 |website=[[The A.V. Club]] |publisher=[[The Onion|Onion, Inc.]] |accessdate=22 June 2017}} Pancholy is active with several non-profit and social policy organizations including Asian Americans Advancing Justice, the New York City Anti-Violence Project, and [[OutRight Action International]], formerly known as the International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#b0c4de; text-align:center;" ! Year ! Film ! Role ! season 1 |- | 2011–12 || ''[[Whitney (TV series)|Whitney]]'' || Neal || 22 || Main season 1 |- | 2013–16 || ''[[Sanjay and Craig]]'' || Sanjay Patel || 60 || Main role, voice only; has exactly the same name as his ''Weeds'' character. |- | 2014 || ''[[The Good Wife]]'' || Dev Jain || rowspan="3"|1 || Episode "Parallel Construction, Bitches" |- | 2014 || ''[[Wander Over Yonder]]'' || TBA || Voice Only |- | 2016 || ''[[The Muppets (TV series)|The Muppets]]'' || Photographer || Episode: "Got Silk?" |- | 2017 || ''[[Star Trek Discovery]]'' || Dr. Nambue || || Cast Member |- | 2017 || ''[[Friends From College]]'' || Patel ||1 ||Episode: "A Night of Surprises" |- | 2017, 2018 || ''[[Milo Murphy's Law]]'' || Neal/Baljeet Tjinder || 2 || | Episodes: "Love Toboggan" and "Phineas and Ferb Crossover" |- | 2018 || ''[[Elementary (TV series)|Elementary]]'' || Alfonse Kapoor ||1 ||Episode: "Our Time Is Up" |} ===Stage=== {| class="wikitable" ! Jacobs Theatre]] | Broadway |- | 2016 | ''The Taming of The Shrew'' | Katharina Minola | [[Shakespeare Theatre Company]] at [[Sidney Harman Hall]] | {{n/a}} |- | 2018 | ''Good for Otto'' | Alex | [[Pershing Square Signature Center]] | Off-Broadway |- | 2018 | ''The Remains'' | Kevin | [[Studio Theatre (Washington, D.C.)|Studio Theatre]] | {{n/a}} |} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://niralimagazine.com/2006/12/out-of-the-weeds/ Out of the Weeds, Nirali Magazine, December 2006] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070929102701/http://televisionwithoutpity.com/portal/site/TelevisionWithoutPity/menuitem.766266d5c663f366b180b41045001d30/?vgnextoid=774fbbd6e4144110VgnVCM1000006dc1d240RCRD&vgnextfmt=default&ShowName=Weeds Television Without Pity- The Maulik Pancholy Interview] *{{IMDb name|997689|Maulik Pancholy}} {{Portal bar|Film|LGBT}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pancholy, Maulik}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American male actors of Indian descent]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:LGBT entertainers from the United States]] [[Category:Gay actors]] [[Category:Northwestern University School of Communication alumni]] [[Category:Male actors from Dayton, Ohio]] [[Category:Yale School of Drama alumni]] [[Category:American people of Gujarati descent]] [[Category:American people of Indian descent]] [[Category:LGBT rights activists from the United States]] [[Category:LGBT American people of Asian descent]] [[Category:LGBT people from Ohio]]
